programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon investigate more of the stories you send in to our HQ every week. In today's edition, the case of a family whose once-loved home is now a wrecked shell after an insurance claim made six years ago went disastrously wrong. Also, in 2018, the then local government minister, Rishi Sunak, came on our programme to promise a new set of rules to keep private parking companies in check. While he's come a long way since then, the new rules appear to have stalled - we're asking why. And we help two mums and their 26-strong party of karate enthusiasts get a refund out of the airline that seems to be refusing their rights.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback S3 (5/10)
programme.desc: A train driver suffers facial injuries after a brick is hurled at his cab.

programme.title: Defenders UK S5 (5/10)
programme.desc: Our Defenders track down a loan shark targeting hard-up families.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (40/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire and Dover.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The market town of Leominster is the destination for today's show. Guiding the teams around an antiques centre in the Herefordshire town are Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell, but which team will make the biggest profit or the smallest loss at auction? Meanwhile, presenter Eric Knowles visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library, where the books are kept under lock and key.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Hope Street S2 (9/10)
programme.desc: Finn is away receiving treatment for PTSD. Concepta takes his place on a fishing trip.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S4 (20/30)
programme.desc: EJ Osborne finds an armchair, old scaffolding props and a collection of floorboards.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S22 (39/55)
programme.desc: Today's couple want to move to Dorset, just one county away from their current home.

programme.title: The Bidding Room S4 (2/30)
programme.desc: Five dealers bid to buy a diving helmet, a Steiff bear and a Basil Brush ride-on toy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S9
programme.desc: The team restore a pair of old football boots, a boxing trophy and a vintage globe.

programme.title: Pointless S28
programme.desc: The quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Sally Lindsay.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: If it's got Britain talking then it will get talked about on The One Show. Live every evening Monday to Friday we bring you the stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: A Question of Sport S52
programme.desc: Host Paddy McGuinness and team captains Sam Quek and Ugo Monye are joined by World Cup-winning cricketer Tammy Beaumont, Rugby League great Robbie Hunter-Paul, Paralympic swimming champion Maisie Summers-Newton and Premier League midfielder Fabrice Muamba.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You? S16
programme.desc: Rob Brydon and team captains Lee Mack and David Mitchell are joined by guests Shirley Ballas, Steven Bartlett, Josie Gibson and Chris McCausland. They all reveal extraordinary stories about themselves, but are they telling the truth or making it all up?

programme.title: MasterChef S19
programme.desc: It's the end of Knockout Week, and the competition has now been whittled down to ten extremely talented amateur cooks, all of whom are desperate to reach the MasterChef semi-finals. Their challenge is to make a dish that the judges can eat with their hands. The stakes are high, because at the end, two contestants will be sent home and their dream of raising the MasterChef 2023 trophy will be over. For the remaining eight who have become semi-finalists, they are about to embark on a culinary adventure like no other.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You S65
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc is guest host, with panellists comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Black Ops S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: Dom and Kay are given a large package of drugs to sell for the gang.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, with reports from BBC correspondents worldwide.

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show S2
programme.desc: Filmed in front of a live studio audience, the always up-for-a-laugh and startlingly honest husband and wife presenting duo are joined by another celebrity couple to poke fun at life, relationships, annoyances, parenting and everything in between. They also share their relationship highs and, let's face it, most importantly, their 'beefs'. Other popular elements include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes Or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one just refuses to remove from the house.

programme.title: Bump (First Day) S3 (n°1)
programme.desc: «First Day»A new start for Oly and Santi is spectacularly derailed.

programme.title: Bump (Caring Gives You Cancer) S3 (n°2)
programme.desc: «Caring Gives You Cancer»Introducing Jacinda to Keeks causes tension.
